network

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • network.Client
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Observer

    public class Client
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Observer
    Client.java - This class handles all of the communication between the client and the server. It creates an InputListener object that notifies it whenever a message comes in from the server. The client object sends out messages to the server based on the setup or game play sequence at the time.
    Author:
    Iliya Kiritchkov

    • Constructor Detail

      • Client

        public Client(java.lang.String _username,
              java.lang.String _serverAddress)
        Constructs a client object. The client stores the username of the player as well as the ip address of the server.
        Parameters:
        _username - username of the player
        _serverAddress - ip address of the server

    • Method Detail

      • establishConnectionToServer

        public boolean establishConnectionToServer()
        The client attempts to connect to the server ip address that has been entered in the login scene.
        Returns:
        true if connection was successful, false if the connection was refused for any reason

      • sendChatMessage

        public void sendChatMessage(java.lang.String chatText)
        Sends a chat message to the server when the player has entered a message in the chat box of the game scene.
        Parameters:
        chatText - chat message that is to be sent to the server

      • sendGameMoveMessage

        public void sendGameMoveMessage(int card)
        Sends a game move message to the server when the player makes a game move in the game scene.
        Parameters:
        card - card that the player chose to place on the game table

      • sendGameExitedMessage

        public void sendGameExitedMessage()
        Sends a game exited message to the server. This notifies the server that the player is exiting the application.

      • sendPlayAgainMessage

        public void sendPlayAgainMessage()
        Sends a play again message to the server. This notifies the server that the player wants to play another game with the same opponent.

      • sendGameResetFinishedMessage

        public void sendGameResetFinishedMessage()
        Sends a game reset finished message to the server. This notifies the server that the client has finished resetting the scenes and that a new game with the same opponent can begin.

      • update

        public void update(java.util.Observable observable,
                   java.lang.Object message)
        Specified by:
        update in interface java.util.Observer

        Gets the socket of the client connection with the server.
        Returns:
        socket of the client connection

      • getOpponentName

        Gets the username of the opponent.
        Returns:
